sentences: Gianluigi Trovesi (born 1944) is an Italian jazz saxophonist, clarinetist, and composer.
He has won various Italian jazz awards.
Trovesi was born in Nembro near Bergamo in Lombardy in 1944.
He studied harmony and counterpoint under Vittorio Fellegara.
In 1978 Trovesi won the "RAI TV National Competition for Saxophone and Clarinet" in 1978, and the Critics' National Prize for his debut album, Baghet.
He won Best Italian Disc for the albums Dances (1985), From G to G (1992) and Les Hommes Armés (1996).
Trovesi has toured, recorded and performed with Anthony Braxton, Misha Mengelberg, Horace Tapscott, Steve Lacy, Evan Parker, Kenny Wheeler, Mark Dresser, Han Bennink, Tony Oxley and Günter Sommer.
Trovesi is a member of the Italian Instabile Orchestra and performs in a duo with accordionist Gianni Coscia.
